ï»¿THE WORLD BANK OffcLIamabad Office Telephone: (92 51) 2279641-6 INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEV LM UME, 20-A lahrah-e-Jamhuriat Facsimile: (92 51) 2279648-9 INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION r -5/1, Islamabad, Pakistan Mailing Address: P.O. Box 1025 March 4, 2013 Mr. George Turkington Head, DFID Pakistan Department for International Development British High Commission Diplomatic Enclave Ramna 5, Islamabad Islamic Republic of Pakistan Administration Arrangement between the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, represented by the Department for International Development (either the "Donor" or "DFID") and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the International Development Association Concerning the Towards Integrated Social Protection Systems in Pakistan Single-Donor Trust Fund (No. TFO72030) Dear Mr. Turkington: 1. The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the International Development Association (collectively, the "World Bank") acknowledge that the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, represented by the Department for International Development (the "Donor", and together with the World Bank, the "Parties" and each a "Party") agrees to provide the sum of nine million Pounds Sterling (f9,000,000) (the "Contribution") for the Towards Integrated Social Protection Systems in Pakistan Single-Donor Trust Fund, No. TF072030 (the "Trust Fund") in accordance with the terms of this Administration Arrangement. 2. The Contribution will be used to finance the activities set forth in the "Towards Integrated Social Protection Systems in Pakistan Trust Fund Description" attached hereto as Annex 1, and will be administered by the World Bank on behalf of the Donor in accordance with the terms of this Administration Arrangement, including the "Standard Provisions" attached hereto as Annex 2. 3. The Donor will deposit the Contribution in accordance with the following schedule and in the currency specified in Section I above ("Contribution Currency") into such bank account designated by the World Bank (each amount deposited hereinafter referred to as an "Installment") upon submission of a payment request by the World Bank: LJ Telephone : 2279641-6 L FAX (92 51) 2279648
ï»¿-2- Payment Date based on DFID's Fiscal Year (FY) starting on April 1 and ending on March Payment Amount 31 A. Promptly following countersignature of Two Million Pounds Sterling (f2,000,000) this Administration Arrangement B. By FY 14/15 One Million Pounds Sterling (E1,000,000) C. By FY 15/16 One Million Pounds Sterling (E1,000,000) D. By FY 16/17, contingent on successful Two Million Five Hundred Thousand completion of DFID's Mid-term Review Pounds Sterling (f2,500,000) of their support to BISP* in 2016 E. By FY 17/18, contingent on successful One Million Pounds Sterling (f1,000,000) completion of DFID's Mid-term Review of their support to BISP in 2017 F. By FY 18/19, contingent on successful One Million Pounds Sterling (E1,000,000) completion of DFID's Mid-term Review of their support to BISP in 2018 G. By FY 19/20, contingent on successful Five Hundred Thousand Pounds Sterling completion of DFID's Mid-term Review (f500,0OO) of their support to BISP in 2019 TOTAL Nine Million Pounds Sterling (Â£9,000,000) * Benazir Income Support Program ("BISP") is the Islamic Republic of Pakistan's ("Pakistan") response to the 2007-2008 double digit inflation to provide direct and speedy relief to the underprivileged sections of the society. 4. When making any deposit, the Donor will instruct its bank to include in its deposit details information (remittance advice) field of its SWIFT deposit message, information indicating: the amount deposited, that the deposit is made by the Donor for TF072030 (the Towards Integrated Social Protection Systems in Pakistan Single-Donor Trust Fund), and the date of the deposit (the "Deposit Instructions"). In addition, the Donor will provide a copy of the Deposit Instructions to the World Bank's Accounting Trust Funds Division by e-mail sent to tfremitadvice@worldbank.org or by fax sent to +1 (202) 614-1315. 5. Except with respect to the Deposit Instructions, any notice, request or other communication to be given or made under this Administration Arrangement will be in writing and delivered by mail, fax or e-mail to the respective Party's address specified below or at such other address as such Party notifies in writing to the other Party from time to time:
ï»¿-3- For the World Bank (the "World Bank Contact"): Mr. Muhammad Iftikhar Malik Senior Social Protection Specialist SASSP The World Bank 1818 H StNW Washington DC 20433 USA E-mail: mmalik@worldbank.org For the Donor (the "Donor Contact"): 1. Ms. Fatima Naqvi Team Leader Cash Transfer Team 2. Ms. Zainab Fazil Deputy Program Manager, Cash Transfer Team DFID, Pakistan Diplomatic Enclave, Islamabad Islamic Republic of Pakistan E-mail: ft-naqviAdfid.gov.uk Z-fazil@dfid.gov.uk 6. In the event any amounts are to be returned to the Donor under this Administration Arrangement, the World Bank will transfer such amounts to the Donor's applicable donor balance account with the World Bank, unless otherwise agreed with the World Bank. 7. All annexes hereto constitute an integral part of this Administration Arrangement, whose terms taken together will constitute the entire arrangement and understanding between the Donor and the World Bank. Unless otherwise specified in an annex hereto, this Administration Arrangement may be amended only by written amendment between the World Bank and the Donor. 8. Please confirm your acceptance with the forgoing, on behalf of the Donor, by signing and dating the two originals, retaining one original for your record and returning the other original to the World Bank. Upon receipt by the World Bank of the original Administration Arrangement countersigned by you, this Administration Arrangement will become effective as of the date of the countersignature. It is understood that this Administration Arrangement is not an international treaty. It is an administrative arrangement between the Donor and the World Bank.
ï»¿-4- With regards, Yours Sincerely, INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTI N AND DEVELOPMENT Rachid Ber essaoud\. Country Director, Pakistan South Asia Region ACCEPTED AND APPROVED: DEPARTMENT FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT By: Date: Name: George Turkington Title: Head, DFID Pakistan
ï»¿-5- ANNEX 1 Towards Integrated Social Protection Systems in Pakistan Trust Fund Description This Annex will be applicable to and form an integral part of the Administration Arrangement for the Trust Fund between the World Bank and the Donor. 1. Objectives To support the Government of Pakistan in a) strengthening the implementation of the social safety net program(s); and b) broadening the application of social protection system(s) in Pakistan. 2. Activities The World Bank-executed activities (which may be described as "components" of activities) to be financed by the Trust Fund for which the World Bank has implementation responsibility are: A) Strengthening the safety protection system in Pakistan through, inter alia: (i) assessments of BISP's institutional structures to determine its capacity to implement its existing services as well as potential new services; (ii) providing guidance for the development of refined targeting methods; and (iii) strengthening social protection capacities of selected implementation agencies including forging federal-provincial partnerships; B) Analyzing the impact of social protection programs beyond the targeted household level and assisting Pakistan in the promotion of dialogue, learning and communication on the findings of this research; C) Assessments of the institutional and resource development arrangements of Pakistan's social protection programs to evaluate its capacity to implement the co-responsibility conditional cash transfer program; D) In coordination with DFID, providing support to the social protection agenda in Pakistan through assessments and analysis of the existing social protection programs to (i) identify areas best suited for graduation; (ii) analyze the potential fiscal implications of existing and proposed social protection programs; and (iii) assist Pakistan in the development of a collaborative social policy framework and effective engagement of the provincial governments nationwide in social safety nets system. E. Support for the management and supervision of the components and activities described in sub-paragraphs A-D above. 3. Eligible Expenditures For Bank-executed activities, the Trust Fund funds may be used to finance: (a) Associated Overheads; (b) Consultant Fees Individuals and Firms; (c) Contractual Services; (d) Extended Term Consultants - No Indirects; (e) Extended Term Consultants; (f) Field Assignment Benefits; (g) Media, Workshop, Conference and Meeting; (h) Staff Costs - with Indirect Costs; (i) Staff Costs - No Indirect costs () Temporary Support Staff Costs; and (k) Travel Expenses.
ï»¿-6- 4. Taxes The foregoing activities and categories of expenditures may include the financing of taxes in accordance with the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures.
ï»¿-7- ANNEX 2 Standard Provisions This Annex will be applicable to and form an integral part of the Administration Arrangement for the Trust Fund between the World Bank and the Donor, it being understood that any plural references in the annexes to Donors, Administration Arrangements, Contributions and pro rata shares will be read as singular references to the Donor, its Administration Arrangement, its Contributions thereunder and the remaining uncommitted balance of the Trust Fund, respectively. 1. Administration of the Contributions 1.1 The World Bank will be responsible only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Administration Arrangement and will not be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, without limitation, any duties or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee under general principles of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in this Administration Arrargement will be considered a waiver of any privileges or immunities of the World Bank under its Articles of Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are expressly reserved. 1.2 Each Donor's Contribution (collectively, the "Contributions") will be administered in accordance with the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as the same may be amended from time to time, including its procurement, financial management, disbursement and safeguard policies, its framework to prevent and combat fraud and corruption and its screening procedures to prevent the use of World Bank resources to finance terrorist activity, in line with the World Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donors acknowledge that this provision does not create any obligations of the World Bank under the anti-terrorist financing and asset control laws, regulations, rules and executive orders of an individual member country that may apply to a Donor. 2. Management of the Contributions 2.1 The funds deposited in the Trust Fund will be accounted for as a single trust fund and will be kept separate and apart from the funds of the World Bank. The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be commingled with other trust fund assets maintained by the World Bank. The World Bank, in its capacity as trustee, has legal title to the funds deposited in the Trust Fund. 2.2 The currency in which the funds in the Trust Fund will be held is United States Dollars (the "Holding Currency"). 2.3 Donors agree to deposit their Contributions in the Contribution Currency stated in their respective Administration Arrangements. In the case of deposits received in a Contribution Currency other than the Holding Currency, promptly upon the receipt of such amounts and the accompanying Deposit Instructions, the World Bank will convert such amounts into the Holding Currency at the exchange rate obtained by the World Bank on the date of the conversion. Where deposits prove to be insufficient to complete activities as a result of exchange rate fluctuations, neither the World Bank nor the Donor will bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing.
ï»¿-8- 2.4 The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be freely exchanged by the World Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursement at the exchange rate obtained by the World Bank on the date of the conversion. 2.5 The World Bank will invest and reinvest the funds deposited in the Trust Fund pending their disbursement in accordance with the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures for the investment of trust funds administered by the World Bank. The World Bank will transfer all income from such investment to the Donor's applicable donor balance account with the World Bank. 3. Trust Fund Fees and Costs 3.1 The World Bank will deduct and retain for its own account, as a one-time deduction from the funds in the Trust Fund, an amount equal to and not greater than thirty-five thousand United States Dollars (US$35,000) as a set-up fee for the Trust Fund upon receipt of funds in the Trust Fund. 3.2 The World Bank will additionally deduct and retain for its own account, as a deduction from each Installment, an amount equal to five percent (5%) per Installment as an administrative fee for the Trust Fund. 3.3 Each Donor acknowledges and agrees that the percentage deductions for fees in this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section are estimated on the basis of anticipated Contributions. If actual Contributions significantly differ from what was originally anticipated at the time of signature of the first Administration Arrangement, or if other circumstances affecting Trust Fund fees or costs change, the World Bank reserves the right to request a change to the terms of this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section, which would be effectuated by amendments made to the Administration Arrangements of all Donors and which would thereafter be applicable to all new Contributions that are provided either as amendments to supplement existing Administration Arrangements or from new Donors under new Administration Arrangements. 4. Accounting and Financial Reporting 4.1 The World Bank will maintain separate records and ledger accounts in respect of the funds deposited in the Trust Fund and disbursements made therefrom. 4.2 The World Bank will furnish to the Donors current financial information relating tc receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the Holding Currency with respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) months after all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and the Trust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the Holding Currency with respect to the Contributions will be made available to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. 4.3 The World Bank will provide to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Fund Donor Center secure website, within six (6) months following the end of each World Bank fiscal year, an annual single audit report, comprising (i) a management assertion together with an attestation from the World Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of internal control over cash- based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (ii) a combined financial statement for all cash-based trust funds together with the World Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon. The cost of the single audit will be borne by the World Bank.
ï»¿-9- 4.4 If a Donor wishes to request, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the World Bank's external auditors of the Trust Fund, the Donor and the World Bank will first consult as to whether such an external audit is necessary. The World Bank and the Donor will agree on the appropriate scope and ter-ns of reference of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of reference, the World Bank will arrange for such external audit. The costs of any such audit, including the internal costs of the World Bank with respect to such audit, will be borne by the requesting Donor. 5. Progress Reporting 5.1 The World Bank will provide the Donors with annual reports on the progress of activities financed by the Contributions. Within six (6) months of the End Disbursement Date (as defined below), the World Bank will furnish to the Donors a final report on the activities financed by the Trust Fund. 5.2 Any Donor may review or evaluate activities financed by the Trust Fund at any time up to six (6) months following the End Disbursement Date. The Donor and the World Bank will agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, and the World Bank will provide all relevant information within the limits of the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures. All associated costs, including any costs incurred by the World Bank, will be borne by the Donor. It is understood that any such review or evaluation will not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trust Fund. 6. Disbursement; Cancellation; Refund 6.1 It is expected that the funds deposited in the Trust Fund will be fully disbursed by the World Bank by October 31, 2021 (the "End Disbursement Date"). The World Bank will only disburse funds deposited in the Trust Fund for the purposes of this Administration Arrangement (other than returns to Donors) after such date to the extent such date is changed in accordance with amendments made to the Administration Arrangements of all the Donors. Following the End Disbursement Date, the World Bank will return any remaining balance of the Trust Fund to each Donor in the Holding Currency in the manner specified in its respective Administration Arrangement on a pro rata basis with regard to the total funds deposited in the Trust Fund by such Donor relative to the total funds deposited in the Trust Fund by all Donors, all calculated as Holding Currency amounts. 6.2 Any Donor may cancel all or part of such Donor's pro rata share, and the World Bank may cancel all or any Donors' pro rata shares, upon three (3) months' prior written notice, of any Contributions (paid and not yet paid) that are not committed pursuant to any arrangements entered into between the World Bank and any consultants and/or other third parties for the purposes of this Administration Arrangement. In the event of a cancellation, the World Bank will return to the relevant Donor or Donors in the Holding Currency in the manner specified by each such Donor in its respective Administration Arrangement the pro rata share(s) of any such uncommitted balance of the Trust Fund, in accordance with any additional terms that may be agreed between the World Bank and each such Donor. 7. Disclosure; Dispute Resolution 7.1 The World Bank will disclose the Administration Arrangements and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance with the World Bank's Policy on Access to Information. By
ï»¿-10- entering into Administration Arrangements, the Donors consent to such disclosure of their respective Administration Arrangements and such related information. 7.2 The Donors and the World Bank will use their best efforts to amicably settle any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to the Administration Arrangements.
